page.title: 06B.B.C.
page.content: On May 22nd. we went to{Holme Moss {Radio Station.}It used to be a television mast. The mast is very tall and balances on a big ball bearing. Inside the station it is large even though it looks small outside. It is the only B.B.C.Station with revolving doors. They have two big diesel engines for if the electricity goes off. They are so noisy you have to wear ear muffs. They have three Range Rovers for getting to "out stations". They transmit radio programmes including local radio and monitor television programmes. It was cold and misty when we looked at the mast. On sunny days{tourists}come to see Nora Battye and Compo's houses and watch the filming of "Last of the Summer Wine" instead of seeing the beautiful scenery, woodland and reservoirs.
